Title: Designing for Financial Literacy: How Adolescent Learning through a Mobile Application
Authors: Kintan Sekar Adinda, Ginar Santika Niwanputri
Venue: 2021 8th International Conference on Advanced Informatics: Concepts, Theory and Applications (ICAICTA)
Abstract summary: A mobile application designed using user-centered design and gamification can effectively teach financial literacy to adolescents.

Title: Analysis of Technology Acceptance Model (TAM) for Financial Literacy on Kids Application Technology
Venue: Turkish Journal of Computer and Mathematics Education
Abstract summary: Financial literacy applications for kids are important and technology acceptance is a key factor in their use.

Title: Pengembangan Bahan Ajar Literasi Finansial untuk Siswa Sekolah Dasar
Venue: Ideas: Jurnal Pendidikan, Sosial, dan Budaya
Abstract summary: A game-based learning application was developed to improve financial literacy competence in elementary school students.

Title: A Computer Application to Teach Financial Literacy
Authors: Michael F. Warder, Tyler J. Gottlieb, Patrick J. Jung, K. Miezio, Victoria Carlson-Oehlers, Bernard A. Cohen
Abstract summary: A computer application has been developed to teach financial literacy, particularly for rural and subsistence farming communities.

Title: The Interactive Web Applications in Financial Literacy Teaching
Authors: P. Pšenák, I. Pšenáková, T. Szabó, U. Kovač
Venue: International Conference on Emerging eLearning Technologies and Applications
Abstract summary: The paper discusses using interactive web applications to teach financial literacy concepts in higher education and secondary schools, but does not mention applications specifically for kids.

Title: Project Berbasis Aplikasi Android: Sinergisitas Orang tua dan Guru dalam Menumbuhkan Kecakapan Literasi Finansial Anak
Authors: Inten Risna, Moh Fikri Tanzil Mutaqin, Ade Fricticarani
Venue: Murhum : Jurnal Pendidikan Anak Usia Dini
Abstract summary: An Android app-based project supports the synergy between parents and teachers in developing financial literacy skills in young children.

Title: Kashing: a financial literacy microlecture app
Authors: M. Samonte, Jobert M. Borja, Luke Nicholas O. Martin, Miguel Lorenzo T. Alvarez
Venue: International Conference on Critical Infrastructure Protection
Abstract summary: A mobile app called Kashing was designed to provide financial education in the form of a game and microlecture for smartphone users.

Title: Financial Literacy Education and Responsibilities in Developing Countries Using a Computer Application
Authors: Michael F. Warder, Tyler J. Gottlieb, Patrick J. Jung, K. Miezio, Victoria Carlson-Oehlers, Bernard A. Cohen
Venue: International Symposium on Technology and Society
Abstract summary: A computer application has been developed to teach financial literacy to people in developing countries, particularly rural farming families.
